See also: Heiraten

German[edit]

Etymology[edit]

From Middle High German hīrāten, which is derived from Middle High German hīrāt (“marriage”), whence German Heirat (“marriage”).

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /ˈhaɪ̯raːtən/
  • audio
    		(file)
  • Hyphenation: hei‧ra‧ten

Verb[edit]

heiraten (third-person singular simple present heiratet, past tense heiratete, past participle geheiratet, auxiliary haben)

  1. to marry
